parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.68

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Enable/disable object as a feature/landmark. Possible feature types:
* 0 - Feature disabled
* 1 - Object is always visible within object view distance
* 2 - Object is always visible within terrain view distance
The limit is 500 map/static objects and 200 dynamic objects including config features and auto features (flying helicopters, airplanes). When limit is reached, function returns false.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object [[setFeatureType]] type

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> type: [[Number]] - the desired feature type

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> Set a building to be always rendered:
<code> building [[setFeatureType]] 2;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setViewDistance]], [[setObjectViewDistance]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- BEGIN Note Section -->
</comment><comment><!-- For example:
<dd class="notedate">Posted on Month Day, Year - Time (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:User Name|]]</dt>
<dd class="note">This is an example note. It is true and verifiable, and contains a little code snippet.
<code>[[if]] ([[Magic Variables#this|_this]] == anExample) [[then]] { [[hint]] "Leave it here for others to read"; };</code></dd>
-->
</comment><comment><!-- END Note Section -->
</comment></dl>

<comment><!-- Appropriate categories go here e.g. {{GameCategory|arma3|Scripting Commands}} -->
</comment>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on October 10, 2017 - 16:18 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Waffle SS.|Waffle SS.]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
For world objects, command effect persists '''after mission restart'''. Map must be reloaded to automatically revert setting.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
